Package chess

Class GhostPawn

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece
      • chess.GhostPawn

  • public class GhostPawn
extends Piece

    GhostPawn is a special piece to be used in Chess game. Contains attributes and methods that are inherited from the abstract class Piece.

    GhostPawn is used for En Passant, it only lasts for 1 turn and is not a visible piece on the board. If the GhostPawn is taken by a Pawn of the opposite color, then the Pawn who left it there is also taken.

    Author:
    alh220, jmuccino

      • allLegalMoves

        protected java.util.List<int[]> allLegalMoves​(int row,
                                              int col,
                                              ChessBoard board)
        Takes in starting position of move, as well as the board the move pertains to. Returns a list of all valid moves, primarily to check for checkmate or stalemate.

        In this particular case because this is a special piece that cannot move, a null value is returned.

        Specified by:
        allLegalMoves in class Piece
        Parameters:
        row - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to a board row.
        col - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to a board column.
        board - the Chessboard object to be referenced.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of integer pairs denoting legal ending positions on the board in row, col} format.

      • isLegalMove

        protected boolean isLegalMove​(int startRow,
                              int startCol,
                              int endRow,
                              int endCol,
                              ChessBoard board)
        Takes in starting and ending positions, as well as the board to determine if a particular move is legal for this piece.

        In this particular case because this is a special piece that cannot move, a false value is returned.

        Specified by:
        isLegalMove in class Piece
        Parameters:
        startRow - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the row of the starting position on the board.
        startCol - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the column of the starting position on the board.
        endRow - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the row of the ending position on the board.
        endCol - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the column of the ending position on the board.
        board - the Chessboard object to be referenced.
        Returns:
        boolean determining whether the move passed in is legal.

      • coastClear

        protected boolean coastClear​(int startRow,
                             int startCol,
                             int endRow,
                             int endCol,
                             ChessBoard board)
        Takes in starting and ending positions, as well as the board to determine if a particular move is free to move or is being blocked by another piece on the board.

        In this particular case because this is a special piece that cannot move, a false value is returned.

        Specified by:
        coastClear in class Piece
        Parameters:
        startRow - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the row of the starting position on the board.
        startCol - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the column of the starting position on the board.
        endRow - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the row of the ending position on the board.
        endCol - an integer between 0 and 7 that corresponds to the column of the ending position on the board.
        board - the Chessboard object to be referenced.
        Returns:
        boolean determining whether this move is able to take place.
